answers.answer: I haven't had this particular problem but I do understand the frustration you feel...I'll be thinkging about you.Suzie

I am so sorry that your dr.'s dropped the ball.. One thing I learned about being sick is you have to become your own patient advocate.. They work for you. demand rush lab results  become Shirly Mclain when she says GIVE MY DAUGHTER THE  SHOT   we have graves and we are nuts so they expect it... plus you are paying them to help you... good luck and just know that it takes several weks for the rai to help.. mine took 10 weks so just hang on it gets better...
The SQUEAKY WHEEL gets the oil ... bark loud enough and they will do it faster to get rid of you ::::hee hee hee:::: C~

Don't be overly nice. If you can't light a fire under them get someone else to do it for you. When my aunt was in the hospital for her diabetes she complained of stomach discomfort around the nurses and she told me she had asked for a med for it for a long time and hadn't gotten one. I marched out to the nurses station and announced "Mrs. W. would like such and such a med, her stomach hurts and has been doing so for hours." in front of the world and she got it a few minutes later.

Thanks for all the great advice.  I'm definitely gonna be more insistant on Monday.  I just want the RAI and my hospital stay over and done with so we can get on w/meds and regulating them.  You would think that doctors would be more aware of what their patients are going though.  Maybe they are just too busy to be atuned to everyone.

question: Okay...so, I've been on the LID now since June 11th and off Cytomel since June 15th.  I was "suppose" to have RAI this week.  I had my bloodwork done on June 29th.  Doctor's office said they got the results late.  Took them all week to see up my body scan today.  Now, hospital says that the report won't get back to my doctor until Tuesday next week and God only knows how long they will take to set up the RAI.  AND...in the meantime, I'm hypo and gaining weight with every breath.  At this rate, they'll have to call the fire department to get me out of the house and to the hospital.  *SIGH*
title: I just need to vent
